div.p: Superintendent Rodolfo Hernandez launches his new video series, "99 in :99," which features District 99 news shared in 99 seconds or less!

Continue to stay tuned to the District's website (https://www.cicd99.edu/about-district-99/covid19), Facebook and Twitter for further updates on Remote Learning, messages from the District and other important information.

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window

p.strong: Join Superintendent Hernandez and his team for a Virtual Coffee Talk

div.p: to hear live updates on what's happening in District 99 and provide the community with the opportunity to ask questions they may have about District 99's remote learning plan.

strong.span: *Please make sure your phone is on MUTE until the opportunity is provided for questions

hr.p: District 99 was made aware that an employee has tested positive for COVID-19. Due to the confidential nature of individual health records, we are not at liberty to share additional information about the individual.

Per our policies and procedures, the employee has been asked to adhere to federal and state health guidelines. Additionally, personnel who may have been in direct contact with the employee have been notified about the situation.

Throughout the pandemic, we have continued to work alongside Town of Cicero officials and the Cicero Health Department to adhere to all health recommendations and guidelines from both state and federal government and public health agencies to ensure the safety and well-being of everyone in the community.

During this time of school closure, our buildings have been directed to follow strict cleaning and sanitizing procedure. In addition, any employees who must enter our buildings are directed to adhere to the Town of Cicero executive order requiring all individuals to wear face masks and maintain social distancing.

Please continue following public health guidelines for staying healthy during this time, including frequent hand washing, limiting time in public and wearing a face mask or face covering when going out in public for food, medical care or other essential tasks. If you think you have been exposed to COVID-19 and develop a fever or other COVID-19 symptoms, such as cough or difficulty breathing, consult your healthcare provider for medical advice.
As always continue to visit our website and our Facebook and Twitter pages, where regular updates and important information for students and families are regularly shared.

Thank you for your continued understanding and flexibility during this challenging time. We remain very proud of all staff members, students and families for adjusting to remote learning and working hard to continue ensuring that Cicero students are provided the best educational experiences possible.
District 99 Students and Families
Governor Pritzker announced that Illinois school buildings will remain

p.span: FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE 2019-2020 SCHOOL YEAR

hr.p: This decision comes with a heavy heart as we know this will impact all of our faculty, staff, administrators, students and families in some way.
While our schools will remain closed, academic opportunities and experiences through remote learning will continue to provide students with a variety of ways to engage with the school community.

Please know that everyone at D99 understands the importance of identifying ways to honor and recognize students through celebrations, graduations, and student achievement ceremonies. We are working diligently to identify alternative structures that both provide for the health and safety of our school community while also ensuring our students' efforts are recognized and celebrated.
To our students: We know you miss your teachers, your school, and your friends, but please remember that our D99 staff is here for you and will continue to support you during these trying times.
To our staff, our heroes: We know this has been challenging on many levels, but we have also seen the incredible way you have weathered this storm with strength and diligence.

In light of this extended school closure announcement, I understand more information and questions are likely to arise. Please continue to reach our to our identified hotline numbers and our district website for important news and updates.
For now, please do your best to stay healthy and stay safe as we continue to battle through this pandemic.
NEXT MEAL PICKUP
*Two days worth of meals provided
Click below for times and locations:
Superintendent Rodolfo Hernandez launches his new video series
which features District 99 news shared in 99 seconds or less!

span.a: VISIT OUR REMOTE LEARNING WEB PAGE
CLICK HERE FOR STUDENT REMOTE LEARNING RESOURCES

hr.p: We will also be sharing parent newsletters with important dates along with news, updates and tips on what Cicero District 99 is doing during the COVID-19. Please click below for digital copies of the newsletter:

p.span: ***CORRECTION: There is a printing error in the newsletters that were sent through mail and passed out at meal pickups that could be misinterpreted. The Town of Cicero government offices are open. The government offices of District 99 Schools are closed.

Residents (and employees) entering Cicero Town Hall will have their temperatures screened. No other information will be required. Anyone with a temperature of 100 or above will not be allowed into Town Hall.
We apologize for any confusion and we appreciate everyone's cooperation during this COVID-19 pandemic.***

hr.p: Parents, if you have NOT taken the survey

span.a: CLICK HERE TO SEE THE PHOTOS
